title: Chef @Soup & Sandwich Shop
description:
Chef @ Soup & Sandwich Shop  
Work in a fast paced culinary haven of soups, salads and sandwiches in Cranbury, NJ.

Looking for a chef with the below attributes

Leadership: manage and motivate staff to become better

Communication: be able to communicate and instruct other staff, communicate problems arising or tools that can help get the job done better to owners, relationships with vendors (ie communicating when products are wrong, what is needed for special menus, ordering), communicate with the customers (in house and catering) if needed

Creativity: open creativity. Seasonal specials menu must be recipe tested, priced, and tasted before “first day of season” - both restaurants must have same menu and be able to execute with proper equipment and space. Must design a menu that customers will enjoy around our food model and seasonal ingredients

Experience: Ability to notice when quality is not consistent in product. Ability to taste and smell product to know if the product is good or bad.

Must recognize when the quapity of food is not met. (ie. If you wouldn’t feed it to your family, friends, wife, husband, children- it shouldn’t be presented to our customers)

Experience in a kitchen of 3+ years. Culinary school not necessary

Physical stamina and dexterity: be able to stand long hours on feet- daily break are a must and the ability to handle knives and kitchen equipment/tools properly

Time and stress management: everything in our kitchens are made to order. Even our fries are cooked to order. Nothing hot is heated- chicken for sandwiches are marinated and cooked for every order from raw state.

We have nothing premade (other than soups of the day). Must be able to time tickets properly during a rush (ie. hot vs cold food items)

A lot of tickets are Togo and people are coming on lunch breaks, speed is a necessity.

Catering, lunch or dinner rush can lead to stress- must be able to properly handle stress and lead their team during these times

Catering- must be able to coordinate delivery times for catering orders, understand the local area and where every delivery order is going to. Properly communicate to the team what needs to be done and prepared the day of, and communicate to the prep team what is needed for day of delivery.

Core value- must understand our restaurants vision and where we see ourselves in the future. As the chef of the kitchen, our vision for the future of the restaurant should be shared with your vision

-great opportunity to grow with us !

If this sound like you--than come join the team :)

description:
***Productori™*** is looking for a Product Management / UX Design Assistant as we prepare to launch our new AI-Based Professional Training Software for Retail Stores in 1st quarter 2025.

This will be a part-time opportunity to start, but can transition into a full-time position quickly. It will be a remote working arrangement, with some time flexibility (during the p/t beginning phase).

**The Organization / Product**

***Productori*** represents a new paradigm in staff training for retail stores.

Unlike all other staff training software that is focused mainly on HR related content; ***Productori’s*** main focus is on training staff on the products they sell.

We achieve this by integrating the products that the store sells with a unique 5-step training process that allows staff to:

* Memorize the details of the products they sell
* Then apply that knowledge in simulated, customer interaction scenarios, just like they will face everyday in their job.

Including:

* A brand new approach to product memorization tools
* An arcade of learning/memorization games; including a new gamification genre that not only teaches, but is also fascinating to play
* A first of its kind, Customer Simulator; that utilizes AI-Generated simulations of the store, with customer avatars asking the same questions staff will face at work (similar to a flight simulator used by pilots, or a ‘halo-deck’)

**The Job:**

To start, you will be assisting the CEO/Founder of ***Productori*** in all aspects of product development & management in an early-stage software company. So, you will be involved with a little bit of everything (and wearing many hats) related to software product management / development and UX-design.

This will include helping to coordinate internal and external professionals within product development functions: Content, UX, UI Design, and Software Engineering.

You will also be assisting in UX Design & Product Feature Development via our High-Fidelity Figma Prototypes; and helping to prepare parts of the prototype for hand-off to UI Designers and Software Engineers.

So you will be working extensively with ‘Figma’ prototyping software; while you do not need to be an expert in Figma, you will need a solid foundation

Software coding will not be required for this position, but you will need to be able to communicate with Software Engineers. However, if you do have a foundation in web-based / PWA coding, there may be additional software engineering opportunities.

While we are still a pre-launch startup, we are in the ‘last-mile’ push to launching in 1st Quarter 2025.

So even though this position will start off as a part-time position, there will be opportunities to progress into a full time role rather quickly; either continuing in a product management role, or a parallel move into related roles within Product Development.

This will be a hybrid position (but mostly remote), and some degree of time flexibility (while it’s still part-time).

The compensation will be $20-$25 per hour, to start, depending on skill set & experience.

We realize that this initial compensation may be lower than current market rates for a Product Development Assistant. However, if you can hang in there for just a little while; your compensation will increase quickly, and you can find yourself on the ground-floor of a new startup, operating in a business space that is consistently ranked as one of the most promising & profitable segments of AI-powered software.

**Apply:**

Please include your resume and any links to websites, profiles, portfolios, etc.. that might be relevant.

Also feel free to include an optional short cover letter as to why you would be a good fit for this role, and a team member of ***Productori.***

description:

First, a little intro to us: We are a ten+ year salon, with a staff of thirteen other women. Every one of us has our own personality, interests and the stylists, a unique style and clientele. The atmosphere is fun, non competitive, non dramatic, and busy!

We are looking for someone to join our team who is excited to work Mondays & Saturdays. On Mondays, we are looking for 12:30-3:00 where the salon is still closed, to open up after being closed on Sunday. On Saturdays, we open at 8, which makes start time 7:30 am, and we close at 3:00, putting you out of the salon by 3:20pm most Saturdays. The rest of the week we can be a little flexible on, so long as our Saturday need is met.

The responsibilities are prioritized, firstly in customer service:

* greeting clients as they walk through the door, checking them into a computer, making coffee/tea/water. Giving them an indication of where they will be heading next, and in how long.
* Alerting stylists to the arrival of their clients
* checking them out at completion of their services (cash handling, booking future appointments through our Vagaro software).
* Answering phones and booking appointments while considering the policies we have in place and also providing excellent customer service by addressing client inquiries and concerns

These are the most important duties, but we also need a little cleaning and behind the scenes work:

* towels and capes washed, dried, folded and put in the cabinets
* color bowls and brushes washed, dried and put away
* floors swept after every haircut
* wiping down chairs, stations and sinks
* Maintain a clean and organized reception area

Some helpful skills to have, and other things to know would be:

Skills:  
- Strong customer service skills with the ability to provide personalized attention to clients (MANDATORY)  
- Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written  
- Knowledge of phone etiquette and professional communication techniques  
- Familiarity with technology sales, such as point-of-sale systems or online booking platforms  
- Multi-tasking abilities, especially when something unexpected pops up  
- Organization to help remember policies, open inquiries and client expectation

Add'l Info:

-Professional dress code ( not specific, but no flips flops, butts, boobs, or bellies within reason, no gym pants, gym sneakers or plain flip flops)  
- Hair and make-up on point to your unique style  
- Please leave your drama in your car. If anything comes up, talk to us. We are humans, some of us moms. We believe in mental health, an awesome atmosphere for all, and staying up front and honest. If you need a day, we will accommodate, but need as much notice as possible!  
- We have a few other receptionists to cover shifts if needed, or who may ask you to cover a shift making hours more available.  
- You'll get the perks of very discounted hair services! ( we have extensions!)  
- closed Sundays forever and always  
- staff considers each and every co-worker part of a family <3

title: Chelsea Farmers Market Manager
description:
APPLY NOW  

Posted 9/9/24  




Part-time, $19/hour position available at our seasonal Chelsea Farmers Market in Manhattan. Work hours are weekly on Saturdays from 7am-3pm at the market, located near the corner of West 23rd St and Manhattan Avenues, and a few additional hours at home to file reports and occasionally in the field to help with promotion (generally a total of 8-10 hours weekly).


This is an ideal position for someone with retail, management, customer service, teaching, or other leadership experience, who is interested in learning about and contributing to the local food system. You should be friendly and happy to talk to all kinds of people, willing to do some physical work, able to communicate clearly and with confidence to both your Down to Earth colleagues and the vendors and customers in the market, organized and aware of the importance of good record keeping and reporting.


The Farmers Market Manager oversees day-of-market operations as Down to Earth Markets' on-site representative, working closely with the company's office team to help ensure the market's success and spearhead interactions with market vendors, shoppers and the community:


* Supervising and managing daily operations to assure a smooth- and safe-running market
* Enforcing market rules and regulations
* Proactively and consistently communicating with the office team
* Collaborating closely with the market's co-manager
* Collecting and reporting market data and success metrics
* Setting up and breaking down the market manager tent and display, market signage, and any other Down to Earth equipment as needed
* Posting to Facebook/Instagram on behalf of the market on market days and work with the Digital Marketing Manager to provide information and images from the market for marketing purposes
* Selling farmers market branded items
* Taking initiative in providing customer service; serving as a market host to welcome and engage shoppers, promoting good relations between vendors, our company, and the shoppers
* Assisting shoppers and vendors with use of food access and nutrition programs (SNAP, FMNP)
* Reporting successes, concerns and opportunities to Down to Earth Markets; sharing feedback and ideas
* Occasionally representing the farmers market at community events and through flyer distributions
* Attending weekly conference calls with fellow managers and the Operations Manager

Occasionally filling in for fellow site managers at other market locations  
* 

Physical / schedule requirements:


* Commit to consistently working 8-10 hours a week
* Able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds
* Able to walk and stand for several hours at a time
* Able to work in all weather conditions, e.g. heat, cold, rain, sun, wind, snow
* Lead market set up and breakdown, including directing people and vehicles, moving equipment, and cleaning up the market site as needed
* Complete two days of shadowing alongside another site manager at another farmers market as part of training
* Complete remote training, using a computer or smartphone, outside of market hours
* Complete the required flyer distribution blitz outside of market hours
* Communicate regularly, effectively, and in detail, including filing timely reports, to ensure a steady flow of information between the market and the office
* Monitor and reply to messages from the office, especially around end-of market reporting and pre-market prep
* Have use of a smartphone to use Microsoft Teams, our reporting web app, and Facebook/Instagram/Meta Business Suite during the market day

We are seeking candidates who are available to start immediately. Training will be provided.
